answers.answer: Good luck to you.  My little girl weighed 6 1/2 pounds at my u/s, but I swear it feels like she is about 10!

Well, I have my 38 week 5 day ultrasound 4/5/05 to see how big my little guy is.  Well, little is obviously not the word.  Anyway, as i have mentioned before, the doctor thinks he is really big.  So, hopefully this time next week i will have him in my arms if they induce or c section.  i am so scared about a c section.  Does anyone know if the c section hurts about like a full hysterectomy?  My mom just had the hysterectomy and her cut looks like a c section cut and she said it was not as bad as when she healed from the tear after delivering my brother (10 pounds).

Well honey Should i tell the truth!It hurts! but you will forget all about it when you see your little one.I have had 3 the last one was the best, the first one got infected -at the time for some unknown reason they did my c-section packed it with gauze(didnt sew it shut)  they thought this would promote healing from the inside out!! After 3 days they decided to sew it shut. This last time I said I will just take my chances and sew it shut NOW  and I did much better.Natural is best of course, but if you have to have a c-section you will do just fine. Believe it or not mine was only 5 months ago and I say lets have a nother baby my husband says NOWish you the best it will be soonI keep looking to see if your still posting-I figure when your not your having that BABY

I hope it is soon.  I was with family yesterday (funeral for great-aunt) and they were all like "Oh you look just miserable, look at your swollen feet"  And i am like "yea, i never would have noticed if you hadnt mentioned it 1000 times!"  Anyway, I am ready to go.  I still have some cleaning to do to prepare.  I cut the grass yesterday afternoon (we live in a townhome and the yard is only about 20 feet by 15 feet).  I told DH maybe it would cause me to go into labor!  Well, of cours it didnt.  However, i did blow up the motor in the weedeater and get pissed and i then threw it on the ground and broke the guard around the string.  :)  OH well, grass is cut!  DH was displeased, but laughed about it.
Good luck at your u/s. Can't wait to hear the results!

gonza--I hope i didnt scare you dont want to get into trouble again-  Maybe cut your neighbours lawn tonight!!!  I wish we could cut the grass!!! Finally snow is starting to melt!!shubunkin-- yes let us know how big your little girl is? They always said with gd babies will be big but mine only weighed 7lbs 1 oz  he was the smallest of all my babesdebramaine--I think you and shubunkin when you have your babes need to get together and go to Mc donalds No more diet!!

well, i would cut their grass if i hadnt blown up the weedeater!  anyway, no one said the last couple of weeks would seem longer than the entire pregnancy.  The grass was also very long.  It just grew all of a sudden.  It has been raining lately, but it has also been in the 70's.  It went up to 80 yesterday!  Needless to say I am always hot!

1 pound!  How tiny!  I assume she was born very early.  I dont know about history because this is my first.  All I can go by is what my doctor suggests.  She is the expert.  If she says she thinks my little guy is too big to deliver what am i supposed to do.  I dont want to go through hours of labor just to have a c section anyway.  What do you guys think?

My babes were 1st-8lbs 8oz2nd 8lbs-10 oz3rd- 7lbs-1 oz I dont know about hereditary since My Mom's biggest was 6--Labour--1st  26 hours then c-section2 and 3-- scheduled c-sectionI just read that Terri Shiavo died  that was so sad -the whole situation was.

DD was born at 25 weeks due to incompetent cervix, went into labour on a Thursday morning, bedrest in hospital while they gave the steroid shots to help her lungs mature, and after 6 days of labor I had her Tuesday at 1:23 in the afternoon.  Hard labor for that many days almost drove me looney, I was screaming that I didn't care about the baby anymore just get it out right now.  DS was induced at 6 am and delivered by 12:23 so that was tolerable.DH was 6pds10oz I was 6pds 3 ozs
6 days of labour--GOOD LORDHey gonza  --My SIL had her first in 3 hours so there is a happy ending for you!

Yea, my SIL had her first in like 45 minutes and her second in about an hour.  I just have a feeling i wont be so lucky.  Just a feeling.  I was watching Regis and Kellie last friday and a lady from Canada called in.  Kellie asked about their maternity leave and they get 1 year and are about to start getting 2 i think.  I am so jealous!  I am getting my 12 weeks at 60% pay, but that is only until the doctor releases me and then no pay!  What is wrong with this picture?  I think we should start a petition!!!  Anyone else want to join?

DH and I went to the "Welcome Wagon" baby shower last night and there was a lady there who was having her third baby, the first weighed 9pds4oz, the second weighed 9pds8.5oz and this one is supposed to be even closer to 10 pds.. After the first 9 pound baby I would call it quits. LOL. Is there any way to guess how much your baby will weigh, at nearly 24 weeks I am huge and people keep saying oh that must be a big baby, I have only gained 11 pounds - some of that must be baby by now but how much?  My other two children were very small DD 1 pound 8 oz and DS 5pds 14 oz. isn't history the best predictor when it comes to this stuff.

I posted late last night the following message, I just wanted to post again so everyone would know what has been going on with me.Hi Everyone! I haven't been on here in a while because I'm in the hospital on bedrest. I was admitted on 3/18 with Preeclampsia. So far the bedrest is doing the trick to keep me stable. I'm 35 weeks, 3 days, and my Dr is planning to do an Amnio on Tues to test for lung maturity and possibly deliver me sometime in my 36th week. Baby is breech, (still!) so it is possible I may have a C-Section. If for some reason she turns, we will have an induction. It's been hard being on bedrest and thinking about all the things I could and want to be doing at home. I'm am glad that they are keeping me in the hospital, instead of bedrest at home. I think I would worry all the time and never be able to stay in bed enough. Dh and my Mom have been wonderful about doing things for me. I feel pretty ready with everything at home for Baby's arrival. We can't wait to see her! I'll try to keep you posted on things. Hope everyone is doing good. Take care! KristenToday I found out my Amnio will be Tues at 8am. Hopefully baby will have strong mature lungs. I received steriod injections when I was admitted, so that should help.
Gonza--I will sign itI am one of the lucky one's from CanadaYes 12 weeks dont cut itYou mean you only get paid while in hospital??

What happens in Canada is each pay we pay into a EI insurance so much money comes off EVERY one's pay who works  there are claims for if your injured at work, maternity, disability etc..So for instance you are a man, never have maternity leave , never hurt at work  you still pay the percentage and may never use it.  But chances are one time in your life you will for something

I get paid (i am pretty sure this is all that has to be provided under our Family Medical Leave Act) 60% of my pay while under doctors care which is usually 6 weeks or 8 if you have a c section.  The other 6 weeks are unpaid but you have your job at the same pay when you return to work.  However, all companies dont have to provide this.  It is some crazy rule like if there are at least 75 employees and they have to live within a certain distance and blah blah blah.  Anyway, we arent so lucky!  DH and I have just been saving for this since we found out we were expecting.

My dr won't give me another u/s unless they feel something is wrong !!  I want to know how big she is !!  :(I was almost 10 lbs my DH was 8lbs 5oz.  My DS was 7lbs 14oz.  I wonder where this one will come in !! DH freaked last nightwhen he saw the swelling has gone up my legs all the way to my thighs :(Kristen: Keep us posted on your Amnio results !  Hoping her lungs are mature ! How exciting :) Praying for you girl !

Canada's health care is quite wonderfulThe thing with the States though I think the cost of everything is quite a bit cheaperWisegirl--What was there explanation of no u/s  or is it just b/c you want to know the weight? Maybe they think its not important to justify one. Although as a pregnant Mother you want to know what to expect

Its insurance thing.  I was allowed 2 routine u/s.  1 in the 1st trimester which was done at 7-8 weeks to verify viable pregnancy and age.  Then again at 18-20 weeks for development/size .  My insurance will cover as many as you need if there is a problem (which thankfully there isnt).  My dr won't order them I guess for fun  :)

question: Well, I am off for my 37 week ultrasound! Say a prayer she does not tell me I have a 10 pound baby boy in there! Danielle
title: open forum
